title: Full Time Assistant Manager
description:
**Overview**

The Assistant Store Manager assists the Store Manager in leading a customer focused, top-line sales driven, profitable and productive store location. The Assistant Store Manager must also inspire and motivate others by exhibiting core value behaviors-including a customer focused selling culture, and ensuring the execution of the Store's KPl's. Assistant Managers also must hold store employees accountable to following all policies and procedures.

**Responsibilities**

**PacSun Fit**

* Reflects the PacSun brand by demonstrating passion and affinity for product, brands, fashion and trends
* Inspires and motivates others by consistently exhibiting core value behaviors
* Demonstrates willingness, aptitude, and initiative to learn what is unknown about product, brands, fashion and trends

**Customer Experience**

* Displays a customer-focused mindset at all times and ensures all team members deliver an engaging, positive and authentic customer experience
* Handles customer situations in compliance with policy and procedures, attempts to "solve for yes" and escalates issues as appropriate
* Maintains a clean and well organized store, promoting a safe working and shopping environment to maximize the customer experience
* Shares feedback from customers with the leadership team to improve the overall customer experience
* Performs as the floor supervisor role as needed to cover non-peak periods (breaks etc.)

**Priority Setting / Decision Making**

* Prioritizes and delegates tasks to meet all operational needs
* Displays a customer-focused mindset at all times and ensures all team members deliver an engaging, positive and authentic customer experience
* Supports and executes visual directives and maintains visual standards set by the company
* Drives efficiency in all operational store processes
* Maintains merchandise flow, filling and presentation standards throughout the store and stockroom
* Maintains a clean and well organized stockroom and store, promoting a safe work ing and shopping environment to maximize the customer experience
* Ensures all store associates follow all policies, procedures and all Safety Program practices

**Results Driven**

* Holds self and others responsible for the accomplishment of all operational tasks
* Coaches and provides feedback on Sales Associate's performance
* Supports associate engagement by recognizing and rewarding outstanding performance
* Provides direction to associates to ensure understanding of company directives and standards

**Operational Responsibilities**

* LOP: Leads floor for management team to cover breaks during non-peak periods
* Supervisory level register access
* Opening / Closing Shift: May be required to open or close store during specific periods based on business needs

**Additional Responsibilities**

* Ability and willingness to take on additional tasks
* Adheres to Federal, state and local labor laws
* Secures and maintains assigned company property
* Ability to safely lift up to 50 pounds
* Flexibility with schedule {able to work weekends , early mornings, nights, peak holiday periods)
* Ability to utilize power tools and navigate a ladder as needed

**Qualifications**

**Education/Skills/Experience**

* Passion for product, brands, Fashion and trends
* High school diploma or equivalent required
* Effective written, verbal and presentation skills
* Strong communication and time management skills
* Basic math and computer proficiency
* Previous retail or stock experience required
* Experience supervising teams preferred
* Must be 18 years of age

**Physical Demands**

* Ability to climb, reach, bend and lift up to 30 pounds frequently and 50 pounds occasionally
* Ability to operate a cash register and fold and display merchandise
* Ability to work in store sales floor for extended periods - 95% or more of assigned shift Ability to communicate through oral interactions

Apply for this job online

Email this job to a friend

Share on your newsfeed

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 32 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Shift:

title: RBT/BT - Scotch Plains/Fanwood, NJ
description:
**Who We Are:** We are an ABA agency owned and operated by BCBAs. We are dedicated to providing exceptional ABA services through evidence-based interventions, trauma-informed practices, and personalized treatment plans. As direct providers ourselves, we deeply understand the provider role when it comes to working in homes, schools and community settings. We are a small, close-knit team that works thoughtfully and collaboratively to ensure that quality is provided both to the family receiving services and also to YOU in your employment relationship with us. We are sensitive to the “burn-out” that can occur quickly in our field and we work tirelessly to support our staff to create personalized schedules that fit your lifestyle and needs.

  


**The Opportunity:** We are seeking passionate and energetic Behavior Technicians/Registered Behavior Technicians (RBTs) to join our dedicated team to provide ABA therapy to families in Fanwood/Scotch Plains, NJ and surrounding/neighboring towns. In this role, you will have the opportunity to build a schedule that works for you while enjoying a supportive, flexible and collaborative work environment. If you are a BT/RBT pursuing your BCBA certification, we provide free and quality supervision across invaluable and varied opportunities as a Student Analyst so that you can gain experience consulting in the homes, schools and community settings.

  


**Position Requirements/Preferences:**


* At least 2 years’ experience working with individuals with Autism *(required)*
* Some ABA experience/training *(preferred)*
* Registered Behavior Technician certification *(preferred but not required)*. Must be willing to obtain certification within 6 months of hire *(required)*
* Able to commit at least 8 hours per week *(required)*
* ideally seeking someone who wants to work 15-30 hours per week (*preferred*)
* Has some after-school/after 3pm availability (*required*); preference for those with a mix of both daytime and after-school availability

  


**What You'll Do:**


* + Provide direct one-on-one ABA therapy with clients in homes, communities and daycare settings.
	+ Run individualized treatment plans to address behavior and teach skill acquisition
	+ Collect data on client progress and behavior.
* Opportunities to run social skills groups with 2-6 clients

  


**What You'll Get (Benefits may be part-time or Full-Time dependent):**


* + Ongoing and collaborative support from your Regional Director, Clinical Supervisor and supervising BCBAs
	+ Competitive hourly wages and compensation package
	+ Flexible schedule
	+ 401k with matching contribution
	+ Sick/Paid Time Off
	+ Travel Time Reimbursement
	+ Indirect Hours/Mandatory Meetings Reimbursement
	+ Life insurance
	+ Health insurance with Vision and Dental policies
* Holiday Pay
* Materials Reimbursement

  


**Why Join Us:** At ABA Solutions, we believe in investing in our team members and providing opportunities for growth and advancement. Joining our team means being part of a supportive community dedicated to making a positive difference in the lives of others. With competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and ongoing professional development assistance, you'll have the resources you need to thrive in your career as an RBT or in continued pursuit of your BCBA certification.

  


**How to Apply:** If you're a dedicated BT/RBT looking for a rewarding opportunity in and around Scotch Plains/Fanwood, NJ, we want to hear from you by submitting your resume! We look forward to welcoming you to our team at ABA Solutions!

title: Warehouse Manager
description:
**We are hiring!**

  


*For over 25 years, Forever Cheese has been a leading importer of cheese and specialty food, sourcing exceptional products from Italy, Spain, Portugal, and Croatia. The company also welcomed W.A. Imports – an importer, manufacturer, and distributor of premium Asian specialty foods to the Forever Cheese family in 2023.*

  


*Passion gives us purpose. We are energized by our work in the world of food—the discovery of products, the combinations of flavors, the sharing of recipes, the stories of our suppliers, the growth of our employees and the success of our customers.*

  


*Nobody gets us like our community. We believe in the power of food to open minds, spark adventure and bring diverse people together.*

  


*Education is what we do. We are proud to be food nerds. From product origins and creator stories to product care and knowledge, to storage, serving, and tasting—we bring our products to a wider audience, inspiring an interest and appreciation for the diversity of flavors and cultures that our products represent.*

  



We’re looking for an enthusiastic, solution-oriented, and self-motivated individual to join us. Please consider us if you'd like to:


* Work in a dynamic environment with a chance to make an impact
* Develop lasting relationships with great people
* Have the opportunity to build a satisfying career


We strongly encourage your application, as we value the perspective, experience and potential that you could bring to Forever Cheese. Get in touch and join us on our journey!

  


**About the Role**



The **Warehouse Manager** will oversee and manage all warehouse operations. This role will ensure the safe, accurate and timely receiving and storage of all inbound products and selection and loading of all outbound product, and ensure the safety, security, and efficient operation of the entire facility.

  



This position is full-time, exempt at our Secaucus, NJ warehouse. The warehouse is a high velocity, conditioned facility, and is our primary operational location for importing and selling specialty perishable food products to our customers. We successfully transitioned to WMS operation earlier this summer.

  


**Responsibilities**

  


* Work closely with senior leadership to ensure the goals of the warehouse are being met
* Oversee all daily warehouse operations including picking, receiving, shipping, maintenance, and sanitation
* Respond promptly to any exceptions/issues and provide a high level of customer service
* Train new employees on company policies, safety compliance, and warehouse procedures
* Manage warehouse projects and initiatives and achieve desired results and stakeholder satisfaction within budget and schedule
* Track productivity to meet company’s requirements and maximize operational efficiency
* Maintain physical condition of warehouse; inspecting equipment; issuing work orders for repair and requisitions for replacement.
* Assist with employee schedules, workloads and productivity and ensure that all picking, loading, and replenishing are done correctly and completed
* Manage customer order fulfillment, including labelling, storage, picking, and coordinating transportation as needed to serve the customer
* Communicate and collaborate cross-functionally to assist commercial teams in solving operational issues

  


**What you will bring to this role:**


* Four-year degree or equivalent preferred
* 5+ years of relevant work experience such as warehouse, operations, supply chain, facilities maintenance, military, and/or manufacturing/production
* Previous managerial experience strongly preferred
* Proficient with data entry and inventory software and systems
* Experience with food or related wholesaling or distribution a plus
* Familiarity with inventory control, OSHA, HAACP and other regulatory requirements
* Strong leadership, communication and people development skills
* Demonstrated ability to work in a results-oriented, challenging environment
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills within all levels of an organization
* The ability to make decisions, problem-solve, prioritize assignments and direct the workforce in an ever-changing, warehouse environment
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite i.e., PowerPoint, Excel, Word a plus
* Thorough understanding of applicable federal, state, local, and company safety policies
* Bilingual conversation ability (Spanish) a plus
* Ability to obtain forklift certification


**Work Environment**


* The work takes place in normal warehouse environments as well as in cooler and freezer areas

  


**Our Benefits**


* Robust healthcare offerings: medical, dental, vision, telehealth, FSA and HSA plans
* Company Paid life and disability insurance
* Paid Parental Leave
* Roth and Pre-tax 401(k) options including an employer match
* Generous paid time off policies, including vacation, holiday and sick days

  


*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties, responsibilities and requirements, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function within our company. Forever Cheese, LLC reserves the right to amend and change duties, responsibilities, and requirements to meet changing industry or business needs as necessary.*

title: RN - Registered Nurse
description:
**Now Offering a $20,000 Retention Bonus!**

 **Hospice Registered Nurse (RN)**

 **Job Summary:**

Constellation Health Services is seeking a compassionate and experienced **Hospice Registered Nurse (RN)** to join our team. As a Hospice RN, you will play a pivotal role in providing comprehensive and compassionate care to our patients, ensuring they receive the comfort, dignity, and support they deserve throughout their final journey. You will work closely with our interdisciplinary team to assess patient needs, develop personalized care plans, manage medications and treatments, and provide emotional support to patients and their families.

 **Responsibilities:**


* Deliver compassionate and comprehensive nursing care to patients facing end-of-life challenges.
* Conduct thorough assessments to identify patient needs and develop individualized care plans.
* Manage medications and treatments as prescribed by the physician.
* Provide emotional support and guidance to patients and their families.
* Educate patients and families about hospice care and end-of-life issues.
* Collaborate effectively with interdisciplinary team members to ensure coordinated care.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records.
* Participate in ongoing education and training opportunities to stay abreast of the latest advancements in hospice care.

  


**Qualifications:**


* Current and active RN license in the state of employment.
* Bachelor’s degree in nursing (BSN) preferred.
* Minimum of 1 year of experience in hospice care or end-of-life care setting.
* In-depth understanding of end-of-life care principles and practices.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Compassionate and empathetic approach to patient care.

  


**What We Offer:**


* Competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes 401(k), mileage reimbursement, health insurance and PTO ***(must meet minimum requirements to be eligible for benefits)***
* Opportunities for professional development and training to advance your career.
* A Supportive and collaborative work environment that values compassion and empathy.
* The satisfaction of making a profound difference in the lives of patients and their families.

  


**Why Constellation?**


* ***Family-Centered Culture:***At Constellation, we treat our team members like family. We understand that exceptional patient care starts with a happy and supported workforce.
* ***Recognition as a Great Place to Work:*** We've been certified as a Great Place to Work for six consecutive years, from 2018 to 2023. We're also honored to be among the Top 25 Places to Work for in Healthcare in the US.

  



Constellation Hospice is a leading hospice care provider dedicated to providing compassionate and dignified end-of-life care to our patients and their families. Our team of experienced and dedicated professionals is committed to creating a supportive and collaborative environment where nurses can thrive and make a profound impact on the lives of others.

title: Creative Resource Coordinator
description:
**Creative Resource Coordinator**



Job Description & Person Specification

  

**LOCATION:** 75 Varick Street, 3rd Floor, NY, NY 10013


**EMPLOYMENT STATUS:** Full Time


**DEPARTMENT:** People & Culture**REPORTS TO:** SVP, People & Culture



COMPENSATION: $25 - $28/hour or commensurate with experience

  

POSITION SUMMARY

  

Splashlight’s Creative Resource Coordinator is an integral part of our People & Culture team. This dynamic role will operate at the intersection of HR, Creative, Production, and Finance to drive the following key deliverables:

  

* Help deploy the right Creative resources into the right assignments so that great work can be accomplished, while also leveraging these resources efficiently to increase our organization’s profitability and provide a satisfying, manageable, balanced, and happy work life for our teams.

  


* A passion for making data-driven decisions to manage resource allocation with an emphasis on productivity through sound financial planning and analysis e.g. profit analysis, utilization reporting, efficiency reporting, and forecasting & budgeting that drive exceptional business performance.

  


* Foster an environment where creativity can flourish and employees and freelancers can thrive by implementing people initiatives that continuously improve their work experience.

  



The specific duties and responsibilities of each are explained below.

  

RESOURCE COORDINATION

  

* Working closely with leadership in Creative, Merchandizing, Production and Accounts, help identify and manage resourcing needs for all potential and assigned productions.
* Coordinate, track, schedule, and optimize the utilization of Splashligh’s Creative Resources. This includes Photographers, Stylists, Art Directors, and other Creative professionals.
* Monitor day-to-day project activities and resources, identifying potential instances of under/over utilization and actively work with department leads to address and solve those issues.
* Be accountable for results by anticipating and addressing potential challenges in getting on-time, on-budget deliverables and adjusting the team’s priorities and processes accordingly.
* Play an active role in sourcing, networking, and increasing Splashlight talent pipeline for full and freelance talent for current and future projects, especially eCommerce photography & video.
* Effectively uses collaboration to the benefit of business, and creative teams, ensuring efficiency, profitability, and balance.

  



FINANCIAL REPORTING

  

* Lead the weekly resourcing meeting, ensuring all client-facing and internal projects have been allocated appropriately e.g. teams are in line with capacity and client needs.
* Working with Finance and Production ensures profitability and productivity metrics and KPIs drive resource allocation decision-making.
* Run and analyze monthly utilization and billability reports.
* Analyze any staffing trends and apply findings and metrics to future needs.

  



EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES


* 1-2 years of experience in Creative Agency, Advertising/Marketing, or Retail organization is preferred.
* Experience in Project Management tools (for example, Jira, Trello, Atellio) preferred.
* An understanding of creative workflows is also preferred.
* Experience managing and onboarding freelancers, vendors, agencies, and contractors.
* E2E understanding of how to create, manage and optimize timelines and budgets.
* Working knowledge of Google Apps Suite.
* Highly organized.
* Exceptional communicator.
* Detail-oriented.
* Tech-savvy with the ability to learn new concepts quickly.
* Strong problem-solving skills with a positive and even-tempered attitude.
* Experience working on projects with high-volume deliverables.

  


**PERKS & CULTURE**



Splashlight offers a competitive salary and benefits package including:


* Medical, Dental, Vision, Parental Leave, Life, Long and Short term Disability
* 401K with matching
* Commuter and Flex Spending
* Generous vacation policy & 10 paid holidays
* Pet friendly environment
* 60,000 square feet of upbeat, stylish studio space

  



Our culture is founded in partnership, collaboration, and respect internally & externally.

  

We work as a team, win as a team and help one another.

  

Our team’s mantra - When you are strong, we are strong. Because you are Splashlight.

 **Supplemental Application:** **https://forms.gle/SdxqnVY5EjSMBZMC6**

 **EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT**



Splashlight is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Splashlight is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Splashlight are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, past or present military service, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Splashlight will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

 **ABOUT US**



Founded in 2002, Splashlight (www.splashlight.com) is an innovative and industry-leading visual content partner providing strategy, creative direction, and production of photography and digital video services to the largest players in the fashion and retail industry. Splashlight has helped to perfect the e-commerce, catalog, and marketing content of many of the most successful brands in America. Current innovations include new enhancements that help clients improve the quality and performance of their visual content by using advanced measurement analytics. Splashlight has built a reputation for the finest fashion photography & video. Join us at the helm of eCommerce’s high velocity & max volume world. Splashlight is headquartered in New York City.

title: Employee Benefits Account Executive, NJ
description:
Are you a passionate, energetic, and highly motivated individual looking for the opportunity to elevate your sales career with a dynamic company? If so, we want to speak with you!

  



As an Account Executive at Savoy, you’ll have the opportunity to meet with potential clients regularly to promote Savoy’s comprehensive products and services. You will drive new business revenue by researching and recruiting new broker partners toward the achievement of revenue goals set forth.

  

You’ll become proficient in all aspects of group health benefits, by carrier, market size and including alternative lines of coverage that Savoy offers. Your success in hitting revenue targets comes from a combination of this knowledge but moreover is realized by the drive and ability to influence a broker to work with us based on our reputation of a promise to deliver.  



  

**Responsibilities**


* Drive new business revenue by researching and seeking out prospective broker partners, systematically introduce Savoy services to prospects via regularly scheduled touches
* Host and/or coordinate CE or webinars to attract targeted audiences
* Embrace Savoy’s value-added “Concierge Service Model” for brokers – Train and coordinate trainings for brokers on ways to differentiate themselves by using our Company’s expertise and/or carrier product knowledge in all markets
* Assist brokers in gaining efficiencies to grow business by training broker staff on use of technology solutions
* Continuously identify target markets for broker marketing efforts
* Identify and become involved with industry associations/organizations for business development purposes
* Work in tandem with business development team in properly onboarding new broker partners and introducing them to functional departments
* Understand best practices to interact with Savoy staff
* Attend carrier trainings and industry related events; Stay up to date with latest industry news, product knowledge and other market trends to provide value to prospects
* Develop a business plan in advance of each year as a road map for meeting targeted objectives outlining key action steps

  


**Qualifications**


* Bachelor’s degree required
* 10+ years of group benefits experience
* NJ Health and Life License required
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills; Exceptional interpersonal communication skills
* Proficient skills in Microsoft Office Suite
* Ability to multi-task and maintain organization in a fast-paced, changing environment

  


**We Offer**


* Flexible working arrangements
* Medical, dental, & vision coverage
* Insurance coverage for the unexpected
* 401(k) plan w/ match
* Paid time off
* Company culture/ wellness events

  


**About Savoy**



Savoy is a strategic partner specializing in consulting services. With more than 35 years’ experience, Savoy is a proudly independent boutique agency that provides a full suite of health and specialty benefits, individual health and life insurance, Medicare, a multichannel Contact Center, compliance and human resources services, technology, research, education, marketing, and other innovative solutions through its offices in Connecticut, Florida, New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and Delaware.

title: Heavy Equipment Operator (Utilities)
description:
**Summary:**



Esposito Construction is seeking an *Equipment Operator* with field experience for various job sites across the state. Specifically we are looking for team members in North NJ. Candidates must have experience running loaders, dozers, excavators and various other machines. Candidates must also have knowledge of site work, earth moving, and utilities installation. Experience with pipe and/or utility work is a plus. We are seeking someone who is motivated, hands-on, self-starter with a proven track record.

 **Benefits:**


* Medical Insurance paid by Esposito Construction for single rate.
* 401(k) eligibility with company contribution.
* Dental insurance eligibility.
* Vision insurance eligibility.
* Paid time off.
* Pay: Flexible, experience based

  


**Responsibilities:**


* Operate heavy equipment including excavators, bulldozers, loaders, and trenchers to perform site grading, excavation, and trenching for underground utilities.
* Safely and efficiently maneuver machinery to excavate and backfill trenches, ensuring proper depth and alignment according to project plans and specifications.
* Install underground utilities such as water lines, sewer pipes, and drainage systems, while adhering to established standards and regulations.
* Collaborate with project managers, supervisors, and fellow crew members to coordinate work activities and ensure project deadlines are met.
* Conduct routine maintenance checks on equipment to ensure proper functioning and address any mechanical issues promptly.
* Adhere to all safety protocols and guidelines to prevent accidents and ensure a safe working environment for yourself and others.
* Maintain accurate records of work performed, including equipment usage, materials used, and project progress

  


**Qualifications:**


* Must be able to work in team setting
* Pipe experience preferred but not required
* Knowledge of safety procedures and regulations related to excavation and trenching operations.
* Previous experience operating heavy equipment, specifically for site work and underground utilities.
* OSHA 10 and/or 30 Preferred

  


**Physical Requirements:**


* Ability to sit for long periods while operating machinery.
* Capable of getting in and out of the machine multiple times throughout the day.
* Comfortable climbing up and down steps or ladders of the equipment.
* Physically capable to work on your feet and lift/move material productively
* Ability to withstand exposure to outdoor elements such as heat, cold, and precipitation.
* Good hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity.
* Physical stamina and strength to perform tasks consistently throughout the day.
* The job may require working outdoors in various weather conditions.
* May involve exposure to loud noise, vibrations, and dust.

title: Vice President - Corporates - Credit Risk (Risk Management)
description:
Vice President - Corporates - Credit Risk (Risk Management)

Job Number:

 3256587


POSTING DATE: Aug 7, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Credit Risk
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Vice President

DESCRIPTION


Firm Risk Management

Firm Risk Management (FRM) supports Morgan Stanley to achieve its business goals by partnering with business units across the Firm to realize efficient risk-adjusted returns, acting as a strategic advisor to the Board and protecting the Firm from exposure to losses as a result of credit, market, liquidity, model and other risks.  

  

Background on the Position
  

The role will reside within the Firm Risk Management's Credit Risk Management department, which is a team dedicated to managing credit risk associated with Morgan Stanley's leveraged finance originations business.
  

  

Primary Responsibilities:
  

* Evaluate leveraged lending requests across sectors, (potentially including Healthcare, Technology, Energy, Industrials, Transportation, Services, Real Estate, and others), from Morgan Stanley clients and present and defend recommendations to senior leadership within Credit Risk Management and Capital Commitment Committee
* Manage relationships with the investment banking and capital markets coverage teams, including ensuring proper information flow and appropriately identifying and conveying credit issues
* Prepare and oversee documentation for credit decisions, including credit memos, detailed financial forecasts, and credit risk rating models
* Oversee portfolio monitoring across a large range of investment grade and non-investment grade companies
* Maintain an active view of single name, sector, and industry trends and ongoing communication with senior stakeholders and onsite regulatory team
* Manage credit portfolio regulatory risk and address related inquiries
  


QUALIFICATIONS

* Bachelor's Degree
* Minimum 10 years of experience in a similar credit role
* Experience with leveraged lending, including large-scale leveraged buyouts
* Excellent analytical and quantitative skills with ability to assess complex information quickly and accurately
* Strong verbal and oral communication skills to condense and articulate complicated ideas and findings clearly and succinctly
* Ability to defend recommendations across multiple stakeholders, including credit risk management and the business unit management
* Ability to work under pressure managing multiple time-sensitive deliverables
* Experience developing and managing junior talent



Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $120,000 and $200,000 year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.



Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.



It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.



Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).

title: Program Coordinator
description:
**Summary**



Global Kids (GK) educates, inspires, and mobilizes youth to become global citizens who are positively engaged in the world and are prepared for their future. Global Kids is seeking a highly motivated Program Coordinator to join our team. The Program Coordinator will play a key role in developing and implementing our global education and youth development programs. This position offers an exciting opportunity to make a positive impact on youth and contribute to their global citizenship development.



We are excited to find an individual who shares our passion for youth development, global education, and community engagement.



Responsibilities:


***Program Development and Implementation:***


* Take a lead role in writing curriculum/lesson plans focusing on global content and other key program areas.
* Coordinate, develop, and co-facilitate interactive, experiential workshops and activities for GK's global education academic enrichment programs.
* Collaborate with GK staff and youth to generate new program ideas focusing on global/local issues and meeting the goals of contracted initiatives.
* Develop relevant content and curriculum on global issues, and 21st-century skills while supporting social and emotional learning.


***Event and Project Management:***


* Work with other staff and students to implement the annual Global Kids Youth Conference and other special projects.
* Implement student outreach, recruitment, and retention strategies throughout the year.
* Help support partner school's goals and functions.
* Build and maintain positive relationships with multiple stakeholders such as students, families, school personnel, policymakers, and other community members.
* Occasional evenings, weekends, and overnights with long-distance travel required for events and trips (college trips, student leadership retreats)


***Administrative Responsibilities:***


* Serve as site manager/point person for school-based programs in the absence of a site supervisor.
* Collaborate with the program director on program design and scope of work.
* Work with school personnel on logistics for program implementation (e.g., space, security needs, permits, trip forms/permission slips).
* Collect, input, and review attendance, evaluation, and other data related to projects and student progress.
* Maintain necessary documentation/case files, as well as program data entry and records.
* Complete administrative tasks related to maintaining assigned GK equipment, fiscal procedures (fund requests and expense reports), and other assigned tasks.

  


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree in a related field or five years of relevant professional experience.
* Strong understanding of a wide array of NYC social service resources for youth and families.
* Experience using interactive experiential learning strategies, counseling and conflict resolution skills, and youth development/leadership strategies with middle school and/or high school-age youth.
* Experience and enthusiasm for designing and leading educational workshops that build on each other.
* Commitment to and understanding of working in culturally diverse settings and using antiracist pedagogical practices
* Experience working in or closely with NYC public schools a plus.
* Knowledge of and passion for global issues, political science, history, education and social justice, and human rights.
* Excellent facilitation, consensus-building, and interpersonal skills.
* Strong work ethic, initiative, creativity, willingness to learn, and ability to manage multiple tasks independently.
* Strong communication, writing, administrative, organizational, and technology skills (Microsoft Suite, Google Suite, Zoom).
* International experience a plus
* Fluency in other languages is a plus (particularly Spanish, Haitian Creole and South Asian languages and dialects)

  


**Salary/Benefits:** This full-time exempt position has an annual salary of $45,000- $47,000. GK also offers affordable medical benefits, dental, and life insurance as well as paid holidays, vacation time off, personal days, sick time, and possibilities for travel. GK staff also have access to retail discounts through our Professional Employer Organization (PEO).

  


**To Apply:** Please submit your application through BambooHR, including a cover letter that highlights your abilities and preference to work with middle and/or high school youth. The GK Director of Human Resources and the hiring Director will review all applications received for this role.

  



We kindly request that you refrain from making inquiries via phone, mail, or fax. For more information about Global Kids and our organization, please visit our website at www.globalkids.org.

  



Qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview. We strongly encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply.

  


*Global Kids, Inc is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a policy of equal treatment and opportunity and do not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on the basis of race, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, citizenship, mental or physical handicap or disability, marital status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status or any other characteristics protected by law. We continue to support and promote equal employment opportunity, human dignity, and diversity in all forms.*

title: Administrative Assistant, Sustainability
description:
We are UMG, the Universal Music Group. We are the world’s leading music company. In everything we do, we are committed to artistry, innovation and entrepreneurship. We own and operate a broad array of businesses engaged in recorded music, music publishing, merchandising, and audiovisual content in more than 60 countries. We identify and develop recording artists and songwriters, and we produce, distribute and promote the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music to delight and entertain fans around the world.  

How we LEAD:
The Sustainability team is looking for an experienced Administrative Assistant who has superior attention to detail, great organizational skills, the ability to meet tight deadlines and juggle multiple critical requests. A high level of integrity and discretion in handling extremely confidential information and professionalism in dealing with senior professionals inside and outside the company is important. Will assist three busy executives with demanding schedules supporting media and press. Must be very efficient and highly attuned to the smallest of details, as well as being able to multi-task and work on tight deadlines in a high-pressure environment is crucial. A “can-do” attitude is essential.
How you’ll CREATE:* Arrange meetings and conference calls via telephone and email
* Cover phone lines and manage/update calendars
* Coordinate and prioritize incoming verbal and email requests
* Book travel, accommodations, & transportation
* Maintain a strong working knowledge of employees, and important external contacts
* Work closely with other administrative assistants and occasionally cover their phone lines
* Exercise discretion when patching calls, rolling calls, and interrupting meetings
* Regular meeting prep, coordination, and notes
* Greet meeting participants •Order and set-up food service for meetings
* Promptly address any IT issues
* Interact with vendors and promptly process invoices
* Create and send grammatically/punctually correct internal/external company communication
* Monthly expenses, reconciliation, and processing such as travel & entertainment expenses
* Order office supplies, make restaurant reservations, and approve expense
* Additional duties as assigned


Bring your VIBE:* Minimum 2 years of experience as an administrative assistant
* Experience supporting more than one executive is preferred
* Ability to interact comfortably and effectively with employees of our company at all levels including Senior Management
* Ability to interact comfortably and effectively with external partners and clients
* High attention to detail, excellent follow-through, problem-solving and organizational skills
* Self-motivated, proactive, and resourceful
* Flexible – able to adjust to changing priorities, and able to multi-task
* Excellent customer service skills
* Excellent time management skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication
* Strong proficiency in and working knowledge of Outlook and other Microsoft Office Products
* Creative skills a plus (Adobe Creative Suite, Keynote)•Music or entertainment experience a plus
* Ability to sit and stand for long periods of time
* Bachelor’s Degree preferred


Perks Playlist:* Be part of an entrepreneurial, global organization that values authenticity, drive, creativity, relationships, and a competitive spirit
* Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and FSA options, as well as:
	+ 100% coverage for out-patient mental health services
	+ Wellbeing reimbursements for fitness classes, spa treatments, meal services, travel, and so much more (up to $720/year)
	+ A lifetime fertility support allowance of $30,000 to plan participants
	+ Student Loan Repayment Assistance and Tuition Reimbursement
	+ 100% immediately vested 401(k) match on the first 5% of your contribution on eligible compensation

* Variety of ways to prioritize much-needed time away from work including:
	+ Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) for exempt employees
	+ 3-weeks PTO for non-exempt employees
	+ 2-weeks paid Winter Break
	+ 10 Company Holidays (including Juneteenth and Wellbeing Day)
	+ Summer Fridays (between Memorial Day and Labor Day)
	+ Generous paid parental leave for every type of parent


Check out our full overview of benefits on the Perks Playlist page of the career site.

title: Channel Compute Specialist
description:
Channel Compute Specialist  


This role has been designated as ‘Remote/Teleworker’, which means you will primarily work from home.**Who We Are:**


Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

**Job Description:**

  

Partner / Channel compute specialist drives the sale of HPE compute portfolio of products, systems, and services through resellers/channels to achieve sales and grow market share goals. They work with key or strategic partners and set short and long-term channel strategies. This role will foster reseller relationships, satisfaction and performance. They will develop customer relationships through partnering with key resellers. This role will provide education of HPE compute products through sales and technical presentations and will manage, maintain, and provide reports and opportunity status through regular business plans and reviews.


Additionally, they will analyze competitive intelligence, market trends, and drive alignment with compute business priorities through HPE sales teams. Some key activities include:

* Identifying and penetrating new customers and markets through whitespace and territories
* Growing and expanding spend in existing customer base
* Maintaining revenue from existing customers
* Supporting customer and partner sales inquiries

***Responsibilities:***

* Manage relationships and serve as trusted advisor to executive partner and customer stakeholders
* Identify and develop new relationships with potential customer stakeholders
* Identify additional cross-/up-sell opportunities for strategic, high-growth products
* Understand and articulate value propositions of HPE compute product solutions and offerings
* Monitor and interpret product usage data for an assigned book of accounts to identify opportunities to improve adoption, pursue renewal opportunities, up-sell within existing products, or identify opportunities for a sales rep to cross-sell
* Develop strong, collaborative working relationships with HPE sales teams across the organization.
* Must live within the greater NYC Metro Area and have the ability to travel to customer sites within this region on a regular basis

***Education and Experience:***

* University or Bachelor's degree preferred, or equivalent experience.
* 3+ years of selling experience.
* Experience developing positive relationships and solving customer problems.

**Additional Skills:**


Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Assertiveness, Bias, Building Rapport, Buyer Personas, Coaching, Complex Sales, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Customer Experience Strategy, Customer Interactions, Design Thinking, Empathy, Financial Acumen, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Identifying Sales Opportunities, Industry Knowledge, Intellectual Curiosity, Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity {+ 6 more}**What We Can Offer You:**

**Health & Wellbeing**


We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.

**Personal & Professional Development**


We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

**Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging**


We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.

**Let's Stay Connected:**


Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.

title: Assistant Director of Nursing, Behavioral Health (Overnight)
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue is America’s oldest public hospital, established in 1736. Affiliated with the NYU School of Medicine, the 844-bed hospital is a major referral center for highly complex cases, with its 6,000 employees including highly skilled, interdisciplinary clinical staff. It sees more than 110,000 emergency room visits and 500,000 outpatient visits annually. Bellevue is an academic medical institution of international renown. We have served as an incubator for major innovations in public health, medical science, and medical education. Bellevue is a Level I Trauma Center delivering around-the-clock care in adult, pediatric, psychiatric and pediatric psychiatric emergencies as well as in the nationally-designated categories of cardiology, neurology, toxicology, and neonatology. In addition to providing comprehensive inpatient and outpatient state-of-the-art care Bellevue is a city-wide medical specialty referral source. Bellevue’s clinical centers of excellence include: Emergency Medicine and Trauma Care; Cardiovascular Services; Designated Regional Perinatal Center and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (ICU); Comprehensive Children’s Psychiatric Emergency Program; and Cancer Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**Purpose of Postion:**


Under the general supervision of the Director of Nursing, the Assistant Director of Nursing (ADN) will be an integral part of the Behavioral Health Department to maintain continuity after hours, weekends and holidays. The ADN provides significant administrative support under the supervision of the Director of Nursing with latitude for independent judgement and initiative.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Overseeing all nursing staff during off shift hours, including proper staffing models and adherence to policies and procedures.
* Interpret, evaluate and implement Nursing/Patient Care Sergices and hospital policies and procedures.
* Coordinate the continuty of care in support of the Director of Nursing.
* Direct supervision of non-professional personnel (PCAs, PSHTS, Behavioral Health Associates and Behavior Response Team).
* Plan, recommend and work collaboratively with the Director/Assistant Director of Nursing in establishing a plan to motivate staff and develop their skills to improve quality of patient care.
* Make rounds during shifts on Behavioral Health Units including CPEP areas, ensure that the nursing units have proper supplies and equipment.


- Coordinate care with other disciplines during medical or behavioral crises - Psychiatric Moonlighter, Medical Moonlighter and Medical Consult.

* Work with corrections liaisons to assist with forensic patients.
* Coordinate patient flow of direct admits, interunit transfers and admission from CPEP to Behavioral Units to ensure the continuous flow of patients.
* Performs all other duties assigned by Supervisor and/or designee.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. Licensed and currently registered to practice as a professional nurse in New York State, plus (2) or (3), below.  

  

2. Masters Degree in Nursing Administration, Education, Clinical Specialty or equivalent field and five years of satisfactory nursing experience, of which three years shall have been in a supervisory or teaching capacity; or a Baccalaureate Degree in Nursing and six years of satisfactory nursing experience, four years of which shall have been in a supervisory or teaching capacity.  

  

3. A satisfactory equivalent of education and experience. However, all candidates must be licensed and currently registered to practice as a Professional Nurse in New York State.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs
company_description: We always put patients first! NYCHHC is committed to excellence in health care and the safety of people in the City of New York.

**Job Description**

Under general supervision is responsible for assuring adequate PAR levels of supplies, maintaining stock and inventory.

**Job Responsibilities**:

* Responsible for the supervision of staff within Central Distribution.
* Responsible for Inventory Control of all supplies; maintains perpetual inventory; works in conjunction with the Director of Materials and Central Distribution for smooth operation.
* Monitors the Performance Improvement activities of the Department and measures performance improvement.
* Identifies problems that result in inaccurate inventory balances, such as missing issues or purchase orders, or incorrect item numbers or PAR level books.
* Identifies stock problems that lead to insufficient space, or obsolete or incorrect counts on inventory problems.
* Continually follow-ups with Central Distribution items to improve inventory control methods.
* Prepares PAR level books/logs for inpatient supply distribution.
* Coordinating of staff on various functions of inventory management and distribution of supplies; monitor the timekeeping and scheduling of the Central Distribution staff.
* Coordinates the collection of reports and other documents.
* Performs all other duties as assigned by Supervisor or designee.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. Associate degree from an accredited college or university in Supply Chain Management, Business,  

Engineering, Industrial Engineering or related discipline; or  

2. High school diploma or its educational equivalent; and  

3. Two (2) years of full-time satisfactory experience in supply chain management, stock control and  

inventory, materials support or related area.

**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**Purpose of Position:**


Reporting to the Associate Deputy Executive Director of Nursing, the Director of Nursing (DON) of Nursing Professional Development is responsible for the coordination of orientation and ongoing training of the staff, evaluating the quality of care rendered in the Department of Nursing, as well as for the implementation of the Nursing Department philosophy and objectives, ensuring compliance to established standards of nursing practice as promulgated by regulatory agencies and professional nursing organizations.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Provides oversight on all educational programs for licensed and unlicensed staff.
* Identifies essential competencies for licensed and non-licensed staff within the Department of Nursing and assures appropriate educational opportunities exist to promote the growth and the development of the staff.
* Participates as an active member of the Policy & Procedure Committee.
* Participates in clinical service committees, interdisciplinary meetings and task forces.
* Provide oversight for educational academic affiliations.
* Supports and oversees educational requirements for accredited programs such as Trauma, TJC.
* Assume leadership role in identifying opportunities for improvement, defining goals and developing solutions.
* Serves on committees and attend meetings as required.
* Facilitates the initiation and adoption of changes in nursing practice and organization.
* Performs all other duties as assigned by Supervisor and/or designee.

--------------------------

  


1. Licensed and currently registered to practice as a Professional Nurse in New York State; and,  

2. A Master's Degree in Nursing Administration or an equivalent field, and a minimum of four years of high-level responsible experience in nursing administration, three years of which shall have been in a hospital; or,  

3. A satisfactory equivalent. However, all candidates must be licensed and currently registered to practice as a Professional Nurse in New York State.

title: Service Aide
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Queens Hospital Center is making good on its promise to the people of southeastern and central Queens to maximize both patient convenience and positive clinical outcomes. Queens residents can count on delivering quality medical care right in their own borough. In 2002, the hospital opened a state-of-the-art, 261-bed facility that includes the Queens Cancer Center, the borough's first comprehensive cancer treatment center.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high-quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons


**Work Shifts**
---------------

  


4 pm -12 am

  

**Job Description**
-------------------

  


1. Sets up assigned station with appropriate items before meal service; checks for cleanliness before starting  

preparation of food.  

2. Assembles prepared food on trays for patients according to menu cards or special diet lists. Delivers trays to  

patients and collects/returns soiled trays to the kitchen area. Participates in daily menu conferences and food  

service operations of cafeteria or dining room area, including organizing the serving area and collecting  

dishes and resetting tables.  

3. Assists in cooking operations and prepares patients’ between-meal nourishment and cold foods (e.g., salads,  

sandwiches, desserts, etc.) according to oral and/or written instruction; reconstitutes hot foods in microwave  

ovens.  

4. Serves foods at proper temperatures utilizing appropriate kitchen equipment.  

5. Cleans kitchen and dining areas. Washes, sanitizes and/or sterilizes dishes, working areas/surfaces, utensils  

and equipment.  

6. Collects, transports and/or disposes of garbage and trash in designated containers; runs appropriate items  

through a dishwasher utilizing appropriate cleaning and sanitizing agent(s).  

7. Obtains stock from refrigerators and/or storerooms. Loads and unloads stock, and dispatches and stores  

supplies.  

8. Attends in-service education programs, as assigned.  

9. Performs other related duties, as assigned or directed.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. Ability to read and write English and to understand and carry out simple instructions.

----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online at employment.nychhc.org.

title: Dentist - Level 1 - Per Diem
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue is America’s oldest public hospital, established in 1736. Affiliated with the NYU School of Medicine, the 844-bed hospital is a major referral center for highly complex cases, with its 6,000 employees including highly skilled, interdisciplinary clinical staff. It sees more than 110,000 emergency room visits and 500,000 outpatient visits annually. Bellevue is an academic medical institution of international renown. We have served as an incubator for major innovations in public health, medical science, and medical education. In addition to providing comprehensive inpatient and outpatient state-of-the-art care Bellevue is a city-wide medical specialty referral source. **Duties & Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

  


**Job Responsibilities:**

* Per diem assistant attending of Dentistry with responsibilities of managing endodontic cases in adult patients.
* Will work in the Adult Dental Clinic on patients both in clinic and Operating Room. Consultation on admitted patients and procedures on OR special-need adult dental patient might be performed as required,
* Responsible for clinical supervision and teaching of post-graduate (PG) students of the General Practice Residency (GPR) program for advanced didactic and clinical training in dentistry, perform didactic (lectures, presentations and seminars) to PG students are recommended in accordance with Commission on Dental Accreditation (CODA) requirements.
* Performs all other duties as assigned by Supervisor and/or designee.


Dentists Practicing General Dentistry  

Assignment Level I  

1. Possession of a valid license to practice dentistry in the State of New York; and  

2. One (1) year of full-time licensed experience in the practice of General Dentistry or equivalent experience acceptable to the Medical Board of the hospital.  

Assignment Level II / Assignment Level III  

1. Possession of a valid license to practice dentistry in the State of New York; and  

2. Five (5) years of full-time licensed experience in the practice of General Dentistry acceptable to the Medical Board of the hospital.  

Dentists Practicing in a Specialty Area  

Assignment Level I  

1. Possession of a valid license to practice dentistry in the State of New York; and  

2. Currently meets the educational requirements, including residency and/or advanced training for American Board Specialty Certification.  

  

Assignment Level II and Assignment Level III  

1. Possession of a valid license to practice dentistry in the State of New York; and  

2. Five (5) years of full-time licensed experience in a field of specialty acceptable to the Medical Board of the hospital; and  

3. Currently meets the educational requirements, including residency and/or advanced training for American Board of Specialty Certification; and  

4. Current approved application on file for admission to the certifying examination given by the appropriate American Specialty Board.


**Responsibilities**
--------------------

  


1. Possession of a valid, currently registered New York State license to practice Dentistry; and  

2. One year of full-time, licensed experience in the practice of Dentistry.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

title: Associate Medical Records Specialist
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue is America’s oldest public hospital, established in 1736. Affiliated with the NYU School of Medicine, the 844-bed hospital is a major referral center for highly complex cases, with its 6,000 employees including highly skilled, interdisciplinary clinical staff. It sees more than 110,000 emergency room visits and 500,000 outpatient visits annually. Bellevue is an academic medical institution of international renown. We have served as an incubator for major innovations in public health, medical science, and medical education. Bellevue is a Level I Trauma Center delivering around-the-clock care in adult, pediatric, psychiatric and pediatric psychiatric emergencies as well as in the nationally-designated categories of cardiology, neurology, toxicology, and neonatology. In addition to providing comprehensive inpatient and outpatient state-of-the-art care Bellevue is a city-wide medical specialty referral source. Bellevue’s clinical centers of excellence include: Emergency Medicine and Trauma Care; Cardiovascular Services; Designated Regional Perinatal Center and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (ICU); Comprehensive Children’s Psychiatric Emergency Program; and Cancer Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Duties & Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

  


**Job Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for the review of inpatient medical records to determine the correct principal diagnosis and procedure, secondary diagnosis and procedures; Assign appropriate ICD-10-CM codes to selected diagnosis, conditions and procedures and data entering the same into computer abstract using 3M encoder software, sequencing codes and validating other/specific data elements to assign correct DRG assignments to optimize hospital reimbursement and SOI.
* Designate appropriate present on admission indicator status on all diagnosis coded.
* Placed selected DRG assignments on "hold" status and set aside to facilitate DRG validation.
* Refer and discuss problematic cases to DRG Validators or manager for input, prior to finalizing case to ensure accuracy.
* Discuss cases in question with appropriate members of the medical staff, as needed.
* Assist with mandatory city and state sterilization, dementia and congenital anomalies, where appropriate.
* Remain abreast of all coding and DRG changes and updates.
* Participate in quality improvement activities and perform other duties of the department as required.


**Responsibilities**
--------------------

  


1. Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university in a Health Information Administration (HIA) or Health Information Technology (HIT) program accredited by the American Health Information Management Association (AHIMA) and six (6) months experience in coding and abstracting medical records in a recognized hospital or health care organization; or  

  

2. High School diploma or its educational equivalent; and  

  

3. Completion of a coding, medical record technology or health information technology program approved by the American Health Information Management Association (AHIMA) and one (1) year of experience in coding and abstracting medical records in  

a recognized hospital or health care organization, six (6) months of which must have been in a supervisory capacity; or  

  

4. Possession of a valid certificate as a Certified Coding Specialist (CCS) from the American Health Information Management Association (AHIMA) and one (1) year of experience in coding and abstracting medical records in a recognized hospital or health care organization, six (6) months of which must have been in a supervisory capacity; or  

  

5. Three (3) years of satisfactory experience in coding and abstracting medical records in a recognized hospital or health care organization, one (1) year of which must have been in a supervisory capacity.  

  

6. A satisfactory equivalent. However, all candidates must be high school graduates or possess a high school equivalency diploma.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Medical Records Specialist
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Lincoln Medical and Mental Health Center is one of New York City’s premier acute care hospitals. Located in Downtown Bronx, Lincoln is a teaching hospital renowned for its Centers of Excellence, and a recognized industry leader in the implementation of state-of-the art medical technology and best practices. Our team of highly trained and caring medical professionals is dedicated to providing the highest quality health care that is safe, compassionate, culturally competent and patient-centered. Comprehensive services are offered in three major primary care areas: Medicine, Pediatrics, and Women’s Health in addition to more than eighty (80) specialty services. At Lincoln, the safety and comfort of our patients is our number one priority.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


Visit us at www.nyc.gov/html/hhc/lincoln.


**Job Description**
-------------------



**Purpose of Position:**
Under supervision, analyze, abstract, code or index patients' medical record in a municipal hospital, medical center component, skilled nursing facility, ambulatory care facility or health care organization; perform related work.
**Example of Typical Tasks:**
1. Review, analyze, abstract, code or index patients' medical records.
2. Prepare and maintain records, abstracts and summaries.
3. May do comparative studies for determining data quality.
4. Complete data correction forms.
5. May supervise and train clerical staff of a medical record department.
6. May organize, file and retrieve medical records.

--------------------------

  


1. High School diploma or its educational equivalent; and

program approved by the American Health Information Management Association  

(AHIMA); or  

3. Possession of a valid certificate as a Certified Coding Specialist (CCS) from the  

American Health Information Management Association (AHIMA); or  

4. Two (2) years of satisfactory experience in coding and abstracting medical records in a  

recognized hospital or health care organization.
